DOC.brief_title: Using Technology Improve Eating Disorders Treatment
DOC.detailed_description: Colleges face elevated prevalence eat disorder , yet less 20 % student report receive treatment . Inadequacies mental health care delivery result prolong illness , disease progression , poor prognosis , great likelihood relapse , highlight need improve modality screen intervention . Over past 20 year , develop comprehensive , online platform identify offer tailor evidence-based intervention individual across eat disorder risk diagnostic spectrum , use minimal person-based resource . The new intervention suite program , Student Bodies-Eating Disorders ( SB-ED ) , yet test large-scale trial via platform delivery . The aim study conduct first national deployment comprehensive platform demonstrate transdiagnostic guide self-help program , SB-ED , yield measurable significant improvement access , cost , outcome eat disorder treatment referral usual care ( i.e. , treatment per protocol student ' correspond college 's mental health service center ) . Twenty-eight college randomly assign receive either SB-ED referral usual care . We enroll least 650 student campuses screen positive DSM-5 clinical subclinical eating disorder ( exclude anorexia nervosa , warrant intensive medical monitoring ) . Outcomes measured 6-months , 1-year , 2-years follow completion online screen .
